result.execSummary:
All charges against Wes Lee Augustynowicz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wes Lee Augustynowicz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wes Lee Augustynowicz

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Stephanie Krueger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
On State's motion, Court ordered case DISMISSED without prejudice.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion to Dismiss without Prejudice

Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Wes Lee Augustynowicz.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for calendar call.  Defense counsel believes the defendant is deceased.  Case passed. 
... 
Case recalled.  Same appearances. 
Parties confirm that the defendant is deceased.  State requests time to provide victim notification.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-3-22

Defendant Wes Lee Augustynowicz not in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Wes Lee Augustynowicz.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 40.
Calendar call scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-30-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 9-21-22

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Defendant Wes Lee Augustynowicz in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.23.22

Defendant Wes Lee Augustynowicz in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: So Milwaukee Officer M. Luczak.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Wes Lee Augustynowicz in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is unavailable, on active military duty. State's requests an adjournment. Defense move to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-7-22
received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Wes Lee Augustynowicz in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Wes Lee Augustynowicz in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wes Lee Augustynowicz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant.  (Wes L. Augustynowicz - #449305, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Letter from defendant re:  open warrant on this case.  (Wes L. Augustynowicz - #449305, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Letter from defendant re:  open warrant on this case.  (Wes L. Augustynowicz - #449305, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Wes Lee Augustynowicz not in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/7/22 @ 1:30p
